name: Asthma
description: A condition in which a person's airways become inflamed, narrow and swell, and produce extra mucus, which makes it difficult to breathe.
cure: Inhalers (bronchodilators), corticosteroids, avoiding triggers.
first_aid: Help the person sit upright, use their inhaler, call emergency services if they do not improve.
emergency: Help the person sit up, calm them, assist with inhaler, and call for emergency help if they don’t improve quickly.

name: Diabetes
description: A chronic condition that affects how the body processes blood sugar (glucose).
cure: Insulin therapy, medications, healthy diet, and regular exercise.
first_aid: If low blood sugar: give sugar or juice; if high: seek medical attention.
emergency: If unconscious due to low sugar, rub sugar on gums and call emergency services immediately.

name: Heart Attack
description: Occurs when blood flow to a part of the heart is blocked for a long enough time that part of the heart muscle is damaged or dies.
cure: Immediate medical attention, medication, surgery, lifestyle changes.
first_aid: Call emergency services, make the person sit and rest, give aspirin if not allergic, monitor consciousness.
emergency: Call emergency help, keep person calm and still, and give aspirin unless allergic. Begin CPR if unconscious and no pulse.

name: Heat Stroke
description: A serious condition caused by your body overheating, usually as a result of prolonged exposure to or physical exertion in high temperatures.
cure: Cooling down the body, hydration, hospitalization if severe.
first_aid: Move to a cool place, apply cold packs, give water if conscious, call emergency services.
emergency: Cool the person immediately, move them to shade or A/C, apply wet towels, give sips of water, and call for help.

name: Epilepsy (Seizure)
description: A neurological disorder in which brain activity becomes abnormal, causing seizures or periods of unusual behavior, sensations, and sometimes loss of awareness.
cure: Medications, surgery, vagus nerve stimulation, lifestyle changes.
first_aid: Do not restrain, clear area, place on side, time the seizure, call ambulance if lasts more than 5 minutes.
emergency: Clear the area, protect head, don’t restrain or put anything in mouth. After seizure, check breathing and place on side.

name: Tuberculosis
description: A potentially serious infectious disease that mainly affects the lungs, caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis.
cure: Long-term antibiotic treatment (usually 6 months or more).
first_aid: Isolate the person, wear a mask, and refer to a healthcare facility.
emergency: Ensure person is isolated, wear protective gear, and get them to a medical facility quickly to prevent spread.

name: Malaria
description: A life-threatening disease transmitted through the bite of an infected Anopheles mosquito.
cure: Antimalarial drugs and supportive care.
first_aid: Keep the person hydrated, reduce fever, and seek urgent medical treatment.
emergency: Cool the body with wet cloths, keep hydrated, and get to hospital fast to prevent severe complications.

name: COVID-19
description: An infectious disease caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus, primarily affecting the respiratory system.
cure: Supportive care, antivirals, vaccination, and oxygen therapy if severe.
first_aid: Isolate the person, provide a mask, and contact health services.
emergency: If difficulty breathing, give oxygen if available, lay on side/stomach, and call emergency services immediately.

name: Cholera
description: An acute diarrheal illness caused by infection of the intestine with Vibrio cholerae bacteria.
cure: Rehydration therapy and antibiotics in severe cases.
first_aid: Provide oral rehydration salts and fluids; seek medical care immediately.
emergency: Start oral rehydration immediately, keep the person lying down, and rush to a hospital to prevent shock.

name: Dengue Fever
description: A mosquito-borne viral infection causing flu-like symptoms and sometimes severe complications.
cure: Supportive care and hydration; no specific antiviral treatment.
first_aid: Keep the person hydrated, avoid NSAIDs, and consult a doctor.
emergency: Control fever with paracetamol, give fluids, monitor for bleeding signs, and go to hospital fast.

name: Anaphylaxis
description: A severe allergic reaction that can lead to shock, breathing difficulty, and even death if not treated immediately.
cure: Immediate epinephrine injection and hospital care.
first_aid: Inject epinephrine if available, lie person flat, call emergency services.
emergency: Immediately inject epinephrine. Lay flat with legs up, call emergency services, and start CPR if breathing stops.

name: Stroke
description: A medical emergency when the blood supply to part of the brain is interrupted or reduced.
cure: Clot-busting drugs, surgery, rehabilitation.
first_aid: Call emergency, keep the person calm and upright.
emergency: Call emergency services, note the time symptoms started, keep the person awake, and lay them on side if unconscious.

name: Severe Burns
description: Third-degree burns damaging all layers of the skin, needing immediate medical care.
cure: Surgical treatment and burn care.
first_aid: Cool the area, cover with sterile cloth, don’t pop blisters.
emergency: Call for emergency help, cool burn with water, don’t remove stuck clothes, and monitor breathing.

name: Electric Shock
description: Injury caused by electric current passing through the body.
cure: Wound treatment, cardiac and neurological observation.
first_aid: Turn off power, check breathing, avoid direct contact, call emergency.
emergency: Disconnect the power source safely, call emergency, begin CPR if the person is unresponsive.

name: Poisoning (Chemical)
description: Ingestion or exposure to harmful chemicals causing toxicity.
cure: Decontamination, antidotes, supportive care.
first_aid: Call poison control, don't induce vomiting, keep the person calm.
emergency: Call poison control or emergency services immediately. Do not induce vomiting unless advised.

name: Hypothermia
description: A condition in which body temperature falls below normal.
cure: Gradual rewarming and supportive care.
first_aid: Move to warm area, wrap in blankets, provide warm drinks.
emergency: Move the person to warmth, remove wet clothing, and provide warm coverings. Call emergency services.

name: Hyperthermia
description: Abnormally high body temperature due to failed thermoregulation.
cure: Cooling down the body, rehydration.
first_aid: Move to a cool place, sponge with water, elevate legs.
emergency: Cool the person immediately using fans, wet cloths, and hydration. Call for emergency medical help.

name: Road Traffic Accident (Trauma)
description: Injuries sustained from vehicle collisions.
cure: Trauma management, surgery, rehabilitation.
first_aid: Don’t move person unless in danger, stop bleeding, stabilize neck.
emergency: Call emergency services. Stop bleeding with pressure. Don't move victim unless necessary.

name: Bee Sting Allergy
description: Allergic reaction from a bee or wasp sting.
cure: Immediate epinephrine administration and emergency response.
first_aid: Remove stinger, apply cold pack, use EpiPen, call for help.
emergency: Use an epinephrine auto-injector, call emergency help, and monitor for shock.

name: Appendicitis
description: Inflammation of the appendix, often requiring emergency surgery.
cure: Surgical removal of appendix (appendectomy).
first_aid: Do not give food or drink, avoid painkillers before diagnosis, rush to hospital.
emergency: Rush to hospital immediately. Avoid giving anything by mouth or painkillers before diagnosis.
